intro: Sweetia bijuga, commonly known as the purple-stemmed sweetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and typically have four petals, with a distinctive purple or pink coloration. Sweetia bijuga is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
